verses.text: The word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* that came to Joel the son of Pethuel.
Hear this, ye old men , and give ear , all ye inhabitants of the land. Hath this been in your days , or even in the days of your fathers ?
Tell ye your children of it, and \add let\add* your children \add tell\add* their children , and their children another generation.

That which the palmerworm hath left hath the locust eaten ; and that which the locust hath left hath the cankerworm eaten ; and that which the cankerworm hath left hath the caterpiller eaten.\f + \fr 1.4 \ft That which the palmerworm…: Heb. The residue of the palmerworm\f*
Awake , ye drunkards , and weep ; and howl , all ye drinkers of wine , because of the new wine ; for it is cut off from your mouth.
For a nation is come up upon my land , strong , and without number , whose teeth \add are\add* the teeth of a lion , and he hath the cheek teeth of a great lion.

He hath laid my vine waste , and barked my fig tree : he hath made it clean bare , and cast \add it\add* away ; the branches thereof are made white.\f + \fr 1.7 \ft barked…: Heb. laid my fig tree for a barking\f* \p
¶ Lament like a virgin girded with sackcloth for the husband of her youth.

The meat offering and the drink offering is cut off from the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; the priests , the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* ministers , mourn.
The field is wasted , the land mourneth ; for the corn is wasted : the new wine is dried up , the oil languisheth.
Be ye ashamed , O ye husbandmen ; howl , O ye vinedressers , for the wheat and for the barley ; because the harvest of the field is perished.

The vine is dried up , and the fig tree languisheth ; the pomegranate tree, the palm tree also, and the apple tree , \add even\add* all the trees of the field , are withered : because joy is withered away from the sons of men.

Gird yourselves, and lament , ye priests : howl , ye ministers of the altar : come , lie all night in sackcloth , ye ministers of my God : for the meat offering and the drink offering is withholden from the house of your God. \p

¶ Sanctify ye a fast , call a solemn assembly , gather the elders \add and\add* all the inhabitants of the land \add into\add* the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* your God , and cry unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*,  +  r 1.14  t solemn…: or, day of restraint *
Alas for the day ! for the day of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* at hand , and as a destruction from the Almighty shall it come.
Is not the meat cut off before our eyes , \add yea\add*, joy and gladness from the house of our God ?
The seed is rotten under their clods , the garners are laid desolate , the barns are broken down ; for the corn is withered.\f + \fr 1.17 \ft seed: Heb. grains\f*
How do the beasts groan ! the herds of cattle are perplexed , because they have no pasture ; yea, the flocks of sheep are made desolate.

O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, to thee will I cry : for the fire hath devoured the pastures of the wilderness , and the flame hath burned all the trees of the field.\f + \fr 1.19 \ft pastures: or, habitations\f*
The beasts of the field cry also unto thee: for the rivers of waters are dried up , and the fire hath devoured the pastures of the wilderness.
